speaker: Master of Ceremonies & NPCs

speaker: Errol Ryehouse
lines: Griffin McElroy

speaker: Augustus Parsons

speaker: Gandy Dancer
lines: Clint McElroy

speaker: Travis
lines: Previously, on The Adventure Zone

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m playing a ghost. His name is Augustus Parsons.

speaker: Clint
lines: My character’s called Gandy Dancer. She’s a wizard.

speaker: Griffin
lines: His name is Errol Ryehouse. He is permanently half-transformed between human and werewolf.

speaker: Narrator
lines: We found Jeremiah Blackwell dead in the street. It has every sign of an attack by one of the Furs, Dylan Mathis. The three of you work for the Grayson Agency. Abigail Mathis, Dylan’s mother and owner of the silver mines south of town, had hired Graysons as arbiters, but didn’t state in the telegram what it is you’d be handling. When Connors first brought Dylan in, he wouldn’t shut up about his innocence. Now he’s keeping quiet. Abigail and Connors have agreed to bring y’all in on this to try to sort it out. It’s midnight now. At 8 a.m. the whole town is gonna be awake. And once they find out what’s happening, all hell’s gonna break loose. You have eight hours. Good luck.

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Dust Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]

speaker: Travis
lines: Here we are. Episode 1, offish. Um.

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] Wait, gonna roll a—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Wait, the arc is called “Fish” now?

speaker: Travis
lines: “Offish,” like “official.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Welcome to The Adventure Zone Fish. What’s going on under-?

speaker: Travis
lines: Fish. No that’ll be the sixth one if I know my alphabet correctly.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: We are doing that, right?

speaker: Travis
lines: The next one is “Extravagance.” Um, so, I was just gonna jump straight into the story but last night, as I was figuring stuff out, I came up with a mechanic that I really, really like that I’m gonna share with y’all. Because I set a kind of time limit on the story, I was trying to figure out a good way to like, work that in to the game. So what it’s gonna be is, I have mapped out a certain number of beats in each hour so you can go to different locations. You know, so for example, during the hour of midnight you could go to two or three locations.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I love that.

speaker: Travis
lines: Then the time will move forward. Now the reason—

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s cool!

speaker: Travis
lines: Now the reason the two or three is— The other part of the mechanic is you have the option to either completely separate or go to places together. If you go to places together, you only have time to do two. But if you separate, you have time to do three beats. And the problem is if you are by yourself, you are without the faction help and the skills of the other people, but you have time to do more investigating.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I’ll miss you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s funny that you came up with that independently, because there’s a— I think a Sherlock Holmes Powered By the Apocalypse game. I’ve heard it a couple times on the “Friends at the Table” podcast that has basically this exact mechanic in it. And I always thought it was really neat.

speaker: Travis
lines: Excellent. Well, I’m a genius. And to put a little-

speaker: Griffin
lines: Or a thief. Or an idea thief. Copyright thief.

speaker: Justin
lines: [underneath Griffin] Or a thief. A thief.

speaker: Travis
lines: One of those two. No, I definitely did not steal the idea. Came to me last night, in a dream. Um, also—

speaker: Justin
lines: While he was listening to his favorite sleeping podcast, “Friends at the Table.”

speaker: Travis
lines: To add a little bit more, kind of pressure to this kind of old West, police procedural I’ve written, certain characters will be unavailable during certain times. Either they’ve, you know, gone to sleep, or they are at work or whatever. And certain locations will be unavailable during certain times. So like, if you don’t go talk to somebody in say, midnight or 100 to 300, you won’t get a chance to talk to them after that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Killer.

speaker: Justin
lines: Cool.

speaker: Travis
lines: So…

speaker: Justin
lines: Everybody’s asleep, also, because it’s midnight to 8.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s midnight, what are y’all doing?

speaker: Justin
lines: That’ll do it, folks.

speaker: Travis
lines: So, we’re gonna start in the sheriff’s office and this does not count towards your time. Um, we are probably only gonna get to the midnight beats, I think, in this first episode, because there’ll be a lot more to talk about here.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: So, also! I should also say that in Urban Shadows, usually at the beginning of a session, the players will go around and say who they distrust, what other player character they distrust the least, and there’s a whole thing about setting up, but the Master of Ceremonies has the option to skip that if you’re starting in the middle of a chaotic situation where there’s already a lot of information revealed. So-

speaker: Griffin
lines: [interrupting] Let’s do that.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m gonna invoke that just because we already have a lot to figure out. I don’t want to add more stuff to that and complicate it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I'm going to say I don’t like Jeremy, the silent fifth member of the Adventure Zone podcast, who is playing the character of Pervis.

speaker: Travis
lines: Take that, Pervis.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, take that, Jeremy, you big donker.

speaker: Travis
lines: So, scene smash cut. So you’re in Sheriff Connors’ office, it doubles as the jailhouse. There are three cells across the backside of the building. In cell number one, which is on the far left as you’re looking at them, you can see a shape that you know is Dylan Mathis curled up on a cot. Dylan is facing away from you, so it’s hard for you to tell if he is sleeping or simply trying to stay as still and silent as possible. Trying to keep himself out of the world. I should also say that you have been briefed by your agency before you came here, so there will be certain things that you already know about the inhabitants and the town, and there will be other things that you will have to search out and find out on your own.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I assume you’re gonna tell us the first things when they are relevant.

speaker: Travis
lines: Absolutely. And those will be the things that you know from, like, putting a name to a face or that kind of stuff. I can tell you, like, who has the business interests and where things are in the town, but as far as the interpersonal connections and who distrusts who and all the gossip? That stuff you’re gonna have to figure out on your own.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Broad strokes, because it’s been about three weeks since we recorded the setup episode, remind me [hesitantly] the Mathises...run the...copper mine?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes, the Mathises are the lead Fur family in town. They run the silver mine. The Blackwells are Fang leaders in town, and they run the copper mine. Sheriff Connors is… the sheriff. His deputy is Rosa, and they kind of constitute the leadership of the Fleshes. But the Fleshes aren’t as— If you think about the nature of a pack or a family, the Fleshes aren’t as tightly knit as either the Fangs or the Furs. So when we start the scene, we kind of start in medias res, as they say, and Connors has been explaining to you that they found Jeremiah Blackwell’s body in the center of town at the intersection that’s kind of like, the main part of town and over him, covered in blood, was Dylan Mathis. So they took Dylan in under the cover of night, there was only a few witnesses and… that Connors was able— Connors and Rosa were able to talk to people and kind of keep it quiet, but they know that once the sun comes up and everyone’s up and getting ready to go to work, they’re not gonna be able to keep this quiet and it’s gonna be out of their hands. So they’ve been able to brief you a little bit about who was there, and we can get into that when you’re exploring your options of where to go next. But when the scene starts, Rosa is kind of nervously looking out the front windows.

speaker: Connors
lines: Rosa, come— come away from there. You’re making me jumpy.

speaker: Rosa
lines: I-I know, I know, Sheriff, it’s just I’m— I got a bad feelin’.

speaker: Connors
lines: Well, yeah. Yeah. Of course you got a damn bad feelin’, there… there’s a murder. Now come away ’fore someone sees you. Alright now, you three. What do you need to know? I want to keep this quiet, and I want to get it done. What do you need to know from me?

speaker: Errol
lines: Well first of all, hi. I don’t think we have to be, you know cut— Cut out the pleasantries.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Well, I would—after we talk to whoever we’re talking to—I’d like to inspect the body.

speaker: Errol
lines: Yeah, I was gonna say looking at the body would be pretty choice.

speaker: Connors
lines: Alright, well, we already sent that headed to The Church—well, specifically, graveyard. We don’t really have, you know, a coroner. Michael kind of serves as undertaker and gravedigger and kind of, I guess groundskeeper at the graveyard. But he’s there around the clock, so anytime you want to go talk to him, Michael’s gonna be there.

speaker: Gandy
lines: My Michael or your Michael? Oh, you have a Michael too?

speaker: Connors
lines: My— my Mich— why would your Michael be there?

speaker: Gandy
lines: Well he’s named Michael, so you confused me with your rhetoric—

speaker: Connors
lines: [Crosstalk] Okay but like, context clues.

speaker: Errol
lines: [crosstalk] There’s lots of Michaels, it’s a pretty common name.

speaker: Connors
lines: Yeah, like, we didn’t— okay, people named Connor, I don’t know about Gandy, you might be the only one of them, but anyhoo, while you’re at the church you might also talk to Father Dante. He’s been at The Church all night as far as I know, so he ain’t like, a witness or nothing, but he might be able to give you some kind of information. Uh… Oh, so as far as witnesses go, we know— so it happened like right in front of the Sterling and, by definition there, because of how space works, right in front of the Wild— the Full Moon Saloon, so you might talk to Wilder there. Or uh… you could check in with Isabella at the Sterling. Oh, uh, I— I think you might check and see if Mr. Silver was working late. That’s… he usually does that, that’s right there in the square too…

speaker: Errol
lines: Sorry, I haven’t— I haven’t been here that long, um… there’s a dude named Mr. Silver here in the town where he mines silver with werewolves who are allergic to silver?

speaker: Connors
lines: Well, to be fair, I don’t know if that’s his real name. His shop is called Silver’s Linings, he’s the tailor in town.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Is his first name Hiho?

speaker: Connors
lines: …No.

speaker: Gandy
lines: That would be funny, though.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Gandy owes me a Debt for having to listen to that joke.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s fair.

speaker: Augustus
lines: Ah, pardon me, as much as it… mortifies me to interrupt a genuine lawman such as yourself, I do have one query. If we’re…

speaker: Connors
lines: Uh-huh.

speaker: Augustus
lines: …So hot to find out who killed Mr. Blackwell, then why do I not just ask his ghost, which is standing directly behind you?

speaker: Connors
lines: Uhh…

speaker: Augustus
lines: Nah, that’s just a little ghost humor. Hi, it’s a pleasure to meet you. I try to keep things light.

speaker: Augustus
lines: One of my classic ghost bits, it’s a pleasure. Augustus Parsons.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m going to take a quick second here to tell you what you know about Sheriff Connors–

speaker: Griffin
lines: He loves ghost jokes.

speaker: Travis
lines: It will explain to you why that didn’t maybe have the impact you were hoping for.

speaker: Clint
lines: Why it didn’t land.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes. Sheriff Connors belongs to a group called the Law. And the Law exists in these unincorporated territories where there is no kind of government established. And the Law is more of like a… a powerful sect, if you will. They are all tainted, but not in the way that you think. They are connected to a demon, but it is a demon whose specialty is justice.  But kind of justice in the terms of like, Judge Dredd justice? This is not about right and wrong or morality, this is about the letter of the law, and so with that, he has been granted certain perception abilities. Certain abilities to be able to discern whether someone is lying, [Griffin Fuck!] it’s not so much a, uh, you know the ability to say, “Ah, the truth is blank,” but more of like, “I get the feeling you’re not telling me something,” which—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Can I… can I change characters and play as Sheriff Connors? ’Cause he sounds rad.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, it’s pretty rad. And as such, that is why, and because you have to imagine people who come through any kind of sheriff’s office door will say “I’m innocent, I’m innocent,” but there was something about Dylan saying “I didn’t do it” that kind of rang true to Connors’ ears. The only reason— [Griffin We’re here] he’s giving this the benefit of the doubt.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright.

speaker: Errol
lines: Sheriff Connors, tell me, you got, uh, you got a time pencilled in to hang ol’ Dylan Mathis by the neck until dead?

speaker: Connors
lines: Listen, this— it ain’t up to me. I want you to understand that. But there will come a time— there is such a, like, tenuous peace here in town. That, like, there will come a demand and if I don’t, it’s gonna, it’s gonna be bad. For everybody. And it’s— listen. One way or the other, it’s gonna be bad.

speaker: Errol
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Connors
lines: Either I’m gonna piss off the Fangs, I’m gonna piss off the Furs, or I’m gonna piss off both. And I wanna avoid that at all costs, that’s why I need you. I’m gonna try to keep this quiet, I’m go— but if I’m out there, you know, pounding the pavement, I’m— I’m… I’m gonna draw too much attention to this. I need you all as strangers out there asking questions, but for god’s sake. Keep it. The fuck. Quiet.

speaker: Errol
lines: Well why don’t we start off talking to Dylan? ’Cause if he was there, and covered in… some blood, we don’t know whose, probably his, you know, we’re not detectives. Uh, but let’s talk to him and see what uh, see what he’s got to say.

speaker: Connors
lines: You can try.

speaker: Errol
lines: I mean, you know. Fur to Fur, I feel like we can find some common ground.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cool! So you want to go talk to Dylan.

speaker: Errol
lines: Wake up, Dylan! Dylan, wake up!

speaker: Travis
lines: Dylan doesn’t move. You can see that Dylan is still breathing. So, he’s definitely alive, and that’s about all you can tell from him lying there.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is he wearing the same clothes he had on when he was incarcerated?

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, he’s kinda taken off his overshirt that was the most soaked in blood, he’s down to like, kind of a… underclothes as far as his top goes, but you can still see that there are some blood stains on it. This was a loooot of blood. I mean, yeah, he was incarcerated about 20 minutes ago. So it’s still pretty fresh.

speaker: Justin
lines: I don’t think that— this may not come up, but just for the record, I can be heard and seen now but can’t currently touch or be touched by anything.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Fantastic.

speaker: Travis
lines: Got it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he’s not responding as I yell, “Wake up Dylan, Dylan wake up”?

speaker: Travis
lines: No. You might have to… let’s say this would be like a hit the streets kind of faction move if you were trying to leverage your Fur… Night faction with his Fur and Night faction.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure. Is he— is he, I should ask ’cause we don’t really know how werewolves work in this world and it’s midnight, I don’t know if it’s a full moon, I don’t know if he’s in full fur form.

speaker: Travis
lines: It is not a full moon, so basically— well, lemme ask you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: How do you think werewolves work in this environment?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think it’s probably around the full moon. I think it’s like, couple days, and maybe at the full moon it’s like, at its strongest. But I don’t think one night a month they take this form. I think it’s like a couple days before, a couple days after, which is kinda bullshit ’cause that’s kind of the Amnesty rules, but um… I think that makes the most sense to me.

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] We can have coherent multiverse werewolf rules.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Yeah, sure. It doesn’t affect Errol, ’cause Errol’s always half transformed, but I think that’s how it works.

speaker: Clint
lines: Could it maybe wax and wane with the moon? Like the full moon, they’re full-blown wolf?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, that’s what I’m saying.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I was also thinking, and tell me if this jives with that, Ditto, like that at the peak of the full moon it is a compulsion. You know, that it cannot be avoided, but on the days before and after it’s more of like, “Just be careful, don’t get too worked up.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure.

speaker: Travis
lines: You know, like that kind of thing of it’s a risk but it’s definitely controllable, especially for elders, you know what I mean?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah yeah yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: They’re a little bit— but when you’re looking at like, young people, with all their hormones and hula-hoops, it’s a lot harder for them to control.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. Their yo-yos and their Pepsi Colas. Lemme hit the streets to try to wake this lil’ dude up.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cool, gimme a roll.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That is a six plus one, a seven.

speaker: Travis
lines: Great. So… that’s a mixed success, so you hear

lines: [quiet, moody] What do you want?

speaker: Errol
lines: Um, I wanna keep you from gettin’, you know, massacred in the middle of town when everybody wakes up. How’s that for an answer there, Dyl?

speaker: Dylan
lines: I can’t… I can’t.

speaker: Errol
lines: “Can’t”— “can’t’s” just a… “won’t” with a pretty face on it.

speaker: Clint
lines: With a C-A.

speaker: Errol
lines: No, listen, that’s nothin’. Dylan, you–you… I don’t care how you feel about it, you’re actually the only one who can in this situation, so… Um… I need you to get up and just come talk to us, I’m not gonna force [Dylan She wouldn’t…] you to do nothing you don’t— What?

speaker: Dylan
lines: She wouldn’t want me to. I promised.

speaker: Errol
lines: Who’s? I don’t know who you’re talking ’about Dylan, you can’t sorta start a conversation in the middle of a sentence, bud.

speaker: Dylan
lines: I’m just so tired…

speaker: Errol
lines: Yeah I mean it’s midnight, we’re all pretty tired, but um… there was a murder?

lines: I’m not! I don’t sleep.

speaker: Errol
lines: Yeah…

speaker: Augustus
lines: I’m a ghost.

speaker: Errol
lines: Yeah, fantastic.

speaker: Augustus
lines: Specificity in all things, young man, specificity.

speaker: Errol
lines: Dylan, listen.

speaker: Dylan
lines: Leave… me… alone.

speaker: Errol
lines: Well no, I’m not gon— I’m not gonna do that. You’re like, in a little cage, and so I can just stand here and talk all night if you want. My buddy here apparently doesn’t sleep, so he— he could— he could keep that going for… god, I don’t know, eternity, Gus?

speaker: Augustus
lines: Yeah. It’s uh… It’s Augustus. And also, yes. I could also—

speaker: Look, I’m in your cage now. This could get very annoying for you very quickly.
Dylan
lines: I’m not saying anything to you.

speaker: Errol
lines: To which one?

speaker: Dylan
lines: Any of you.

speaker: Errol
lines: Oh.

speaker: Dylan
lines: Leave… me… alone.

speaker: Travis
lines: So the mixed success here, just to be clear, is you did find out something, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: “She” wouldn’t want this.

speaker: Travis
lines: Right. But he’s not gonna give you much more than that. You can try to persuade at this point, but it’s gonna be a pretty high roll…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, can I try something else?

speaker: Travis
lines: Sure.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So I have a thing called Bloodhound. When you hunt someone, roll with Blood, on a hit you know exactly where to find them and follow their scent until you do.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh-huh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Can I use that to, in full-blown sort of werewolf, wolf instinct-style, sort of get the scent of the blood on his shirt and, if it leads me to him I know it’s his. And if it leads me to The Church I know it’s Jeremiah.

speaker: Travis
lines: You got it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ’Kay. That is a seven plus two Blood, nine.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, so it definitely doesn’t lead you to him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: It leads in the direction of The Church. But—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, shit.

speaker: Travis
lines: But it’s hard to track kinda that far out? Church is outside of town, but you can just— it is definitely leading away from him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, so— but I could follow the scent and figure out where it goes and find out whose blood it is, so at least we’ve got that—

speaker: Travis
lines: You would, but I mean, that would be you know, a beat, you know what I mean?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right, sure sure sure, sure sure. I’m just saying now we have two pieces of information.

speaker: Errol
lines: Alright, anybody else want—

speaker: Travis
lines: You have a piece, and let me say, and I don’t think this has been a thing that we have pushed in any of our arcs up ’til now, you probably wanna take notes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: There’s going to be a lot of information.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Also, a wolf Corruption move When you start a hunt for someone, mark Corruption, so I think that I just did that.

lines: Hey, first corruption!

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah! Hey!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I thought for sure Augustus was gonna be… alright. I have one Corruption.

speaker: Travis
lines: And you can spend that at our store right outside the gates. This is the information you have, right? I’m gonna fast-forward a little bit and just kinda collect. So here at the start, your options are, this is what sheriff tells you, right? The Sterling is an opportunity, you know that that is the vampire kind of hangout tavern in town, it is also the casino. Then there is the, and this is another thing you know from your briefing, Isabella Slate is now the proprietor of the Sterling, she took it over from a man named Marcus two years ago. Marcus disappeared mysteriously, and basically Isabella kinda turned power back over to the people working there. Marcus was not a good person. So the Sterling is a possible beginning location, the Full Moon Saloon, which is the werewolf hangout tavern. You could also head to The Church and the graveyard, The Mathis home, and Silver’s Linings, to talk to Mr. Silver.

speaker: Griffin
lines: We were brought— we were brought on by the Mathis matriarch, right? It was her—

speaker: Travis
lines: Correct, Abigail Mathis hired you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ’Cause that— that’s the only she I could think of that would be the obvious sort of answer here.

lines: Well, let’s give it a shot.

speaker: Clint
lines: Gandy really wants to take a look at the body.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Nasty.

speaker: Clint
lines: Since her… you know, her skillset is in the analytical, magic kinda thing. I really think she is— feels a compulsion to go look at the body.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, let’s get— that’s— police work 101, get the clues before you…

speaker: Justin
lines: Get the clues.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Before you start talking—

speaker: Travis
lines: You gotta talk to the coroner, find out about the autopsy.

speaker: Clint
lines: Gotta slide over the hood of a car.

lines: Yeah, let’s head to The Church.

speaker: Errol
lines: Alright, we’re gonna go to church, do some Hail Marys and crack the case.

speaker: Connors
lines: Alright, um… we’re gonna be here. So feel free to stop back by here anytime if you need to bounce anything off of us or need any guidance or anything, we’re gonna be here, we’ll see what we can get outta the boy. And if you need us, just let us know.

speaker: Errol
lines: Yeah that sounds— Oh shoot. Hey, Augustus, are you even gonna be able to go in The Church? I don’t know if there’s some sorta like, holy warding or something that keeps you outta there.

speaker: Augustus
lines: I can, I just don’t enjoy it. But to be fair, that is no change from my life.

speaker: Errol
lines: Alright. We’re going to church.

speaker: Travis
lines: So as you make your way through town… the town doesn’t feel right. It feels tense in that way that it— it might just be completely placebo, but in that way that buildings and wood seems to absorb the negative emotions of the people within it and kind of bleeds through like a whiskey as it picks up the flavoring of the barrel. And so as you move through town—

speaker: Justin
lines: Hell yeah, that’s evocative as fuck!

speaker: Travis
lines: Thank you. You have a hard time not looking over your shoulder. You have a hard time not keeping your eyes on the windows to make sure nobody’s watching you. And as you leave town and make your way toward The Church about 50 yards outside of the— the last houses, it eases a little bit. You can see all around you the ravine of the Dry River. In the distance you can see the mountains. You can see the stars and the sky and it starts to loosen up, but still at your backs you can feel the tension. And you’re just breathing a little easier out here, and then as you approach The Church, you see above the door the symbol of The Church, capital “T” capital “C.” That’s  all we got out here in the Crescent Territory is The Church. It isn’t exactly a specific religion or denomination, it’s just a group trying to spread some sort of morality. And then you have two options as you approach The Church you can either head into The Church and talk with Father Dante, or you can head into the graveyard and look for Michael.

speaker: Errol
lines: Graveyard, right Gandy?

speaker: Gandy
lines: Absolutely, let’s go and see what’s shaking baby.

speaker: Augustus
lines: Now that— these are my people.

speaker: Travis
lines: So as you head into the graveyard, it’s silent as… the grave.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hmm!

speaker: Travis
lines: But you can see in the middle of the graveyard—

speaker: Justin
lines: Less evocative.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, you can see in the middle of the graveyard a small house with the lights on inside. The lights are flickering, it’s very clearly either some kind of lantern or candles. I assume you want to approach?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, imagine me kind of uh… I wanna keep following this— following the wafting scent of the pie through the air as I follow the scent. Is it heading towards that house, or?

speaker: Travis
lines: Indeed it is.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, let’s keep following the stink lines.

speaker: Travis

lines: Well, I understand that, but one of the Blackwells, Jeremiah, was uh, took a little poorly tonight, by which I mean he was murdered. And uh, we— there was a blood trail leading this way to The Church. I was just curious if you had seen anything… unusual tonight.

lines: I have a nickname—

speaker: Justin
lines: This just happened on, uh, Terrace House Boys X Girls Next Door, where another Te-chan [sp???] showed up at the house, there was already a Te-chan, so they called him, uh, Oji.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well that’s—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Which means prince, which is the most wild. “I’m gonna call you prince now.”

speaker: Justin
lines: And he actually says like, “I would prefer you not call me prince.” And then literally next scene everyone is calling him prince.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well Terrace House was my inspiration for this.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Good, good.

speaker: Clint
lines: Um, actually—

speaker: Justin
lines: The illegal fan du— subbed Terrace House Boys and Girls Next Door was Dad’s inspiration.

speaker: Clint
lines: She has this homunculus that is— basically is a homunculus is a doll or an artificial construction, sometimes possessed by something else. So she calls him Uncle Oni, he’s about two feet tall, he’s a bunraku puppet. And bunraku puppets are these elaborate, beautiful puppets that have been an art-form in Japan for, for centuries and centuries. And this is possessed by a demon, and Uncle Oni is very powerful, and we already know that she has a Debt to Uncle Oni. And that’s who she goes to when she needs advice.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Is this something— y— you said in the setup episode that Gandy was like a world traveler, is this— is this something that she picked up while like traveling in Japan, or?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yes, absolutely, yeah. She has artifacts from all over that she’s found as she is— and it was particularly interesting to her the fact that basically a demon is alive after death, and so this is kind of one of the ways, here you have a disembodied spirit placed back into a form, that was very interesting to her.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I think that’d be interesting to pretty much anyone.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, that’d be interesting.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I would be fascinated by that.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, cool, so I’m going to say… You can ask three questions of Michael a day. Right? So you can’t just keep coming back here. This is what your Debt to him— this is the arrangement that you made. Or, to Uncle Oni, ’scuse me.

speaker: Clint
lines: Uncle Oni.

speaker: Travis
lines: So you can come ask three questions, but once you’ve used those three questions, you’re done for the day. And I think that those questions Uncle Oni is going to have final say as to how much information your Debt has earned you? And I’m also going to put the limit on them that they’re going to be who, what, where, when and why questions.

speaker: Clint
lines: So Gandy walks into the Black Mariah, there are like wards and, and things that would keep people out. She goes into the— the back part and calls out.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Uncle Oni! Uncle Oni!

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Yes?

speaker: Gandy
lines: Hello—

speaker: Clint
lines: And Uncle Oni visually has this sweet cherubic li’l fat li’l face, but when Uncle Oni—

speaker: Clint
lines: When Uncle Oni is in kill mode—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah—

speaker: Clint
lines: It switches to this really awesome mask.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I was really—

speaker: Justin
lines: This is a— this is a hostile action on your part, Dad. The—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah I was really—

speaker: Justin
lines: A hostile action you’re— you’ve taken against me.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh… I’ve seen— I’ve seen some pictures of some pretty scary looking puppets like this…

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Do you have a question for me, Gandy?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Travis, what is this voice?

speaker: Travis
lines: You know how sometimes you open your mouth and like, a voice comes out? I think that’s the voice of the little, like, forest wizard character from, uh, I’ve only seen on Mystery Science Theater 3000 of like, Jack Frost? And there’s the character and he turns the character into a bear? ’Cause he, like, doesn’t carry him. I can’t remember, but that voice has always stuck with me.

speaker: Clint
lines: I thought it was reminiscent of Coily from MST3K.

speaker: Travis
lines: [High-pitched, energetic] No springs!

speaker: Clint
lines: No springs.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, let’s lean into Coily, I like that.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay!

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: What can I do for you, Gandy?

speaker: Gandy
lines: Uncle Oni, I’ve brought some scabs for you—

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Disgusting!

speaker: Gandy
lines: Uhh, these are from a wound—

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: [quizzical] MMmmm…

speaker: Gandy
lines: And I want to, I want to ask one of— one question, my— today’s question. What is this substance in the wound? What is this powdery substance?

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Well, give me my glasses and let me look.

speaker: Clint
lines: I hand Uncle Oni his Pince nez, and they look really cute on his li’l face, and pops ’em on and is looking through them like they’re some kind of VR kinda thing.

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Mmm…

speaker: Clint
lines: And I also put the— the scabs down on one of the— the tables.

speaker: Travis
lines: Now, I, listen, I’ve watched enough police procedurals, I do need to correct you here. You wouldn’t get scabs on a dead body. You’d get dried blood, and you would get powder, I just don’t want anyone tweeting at you…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, William Petersen, here you go, here’s your dried blood.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m just saying… dead bodies don’t coagulate.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I need to know if Uncle Oni ever says “enhance”—

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Enhance!

speaker: Griffin
lines: While looking at the blood.

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Ah, what is this? Mmm, let me see. [Thoughtful clicking noises] Yes, ah… This is refined, processed silver. It has been mined from the local mine— this is local silverdust.

speaker: Gandy
lines: From the area?

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Yes.

speaker: Justin
lines: So it’s both local and from the area…

speaker: Travis as Uncle Oni
lines: Yes.

speaker: Justin
lines: That narrows it down.

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Gandy, do you have any other questions?

speaker: Justin
lines: Hi, I’m another puppet in your paddywagon that’s just there to get on your nuts about stuff.

speaker: Clint
lines: It’s a ventriloquist dummy that just sits there. Okay.

speaker: Gandy
lines: No, Uncle Oni, I’m going to save my other questions. You can dig right into the dried blood if you want.

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: If you’d like, I could just tell you who did it,

speaker: Gandy
lines: No. No, that takes all the fun out of it. You know me, I’m all about gathering information.

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Okay, just know I’ll be here if you want to exchange me… any more of your soul.

speaker: Gandy
lines: I know…

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: I can just tell you.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Uh, no, I’ll hold off. Getting rid of my soul, I’m not quite prepared for that… and I’m getting a little nauseous just thinking about it. But, I need— may I wear your Pince nez again.

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Of course! Do come back and see me.

speaker: Gandy
lines: And let me tell you one thing This situation is extremely dangerous, and I know we’ve been through some dangerous times before, for those of you who don’t remember the prequel, Gandy Dancer and Uncle Oni in the— the Pits of Despair. So be prepared, be ready, um, this is a very hostile situation, I would hate to see anything happen to my Sanctum Sanctorum.

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Oh, I will protect it, and what will you give me?

speaker: Gandy
lines: Well, I actually was concerned about you, so that’s the only reason I suggested…

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: If I lose this form, I just find another.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Not without my help, you don’t.

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: Oh, the hubris. I will look forward to being free from this body.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Go ahead. Hope springs eternal.

speaker: Uncle Oni
lines: We shall see…

speaker: Griffin
lines: [smiling] Can we do another scene or are you guys gonna just keep dropping one-liners on each other?

speaker: Travis
lines: So, let’s move on to Errol and Augustus. You are heading to the Full Moon Saloon, is that what you’ve said?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right.

speaker: Travis
lines: When you arrive at the Full Moon Saloon, it is now… let’s say about 1230? And it’s a school night, so there’s not a lot of people there. You see the bartender Wilder an older fur, he’s gone gray, he has a gray beard, um, long but well-kept. The bar is clean, he is well-dressed; aged, but still clearly— he could kick your ass if he needed to. At least you, Errol, maybe not Augustus. Are you corporeal at this second, are you touchable?

speaker: Justin
lines: We’ve covered this.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m corporeal, but I’m invisible, basically.

speaker: Travis
lines: Got it. So until you speak, and let’s make sure we keep this in mind, until you speak, it’s possible that no one knows you’re there.

speaker: Griffin and Justin
lines: That’s the idea.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s the idea. Um, and also sitting at this bar there are two women. They are not sitting together, they are fairly far apart, it’s clear that they are not with each other. But one you recognize as your employer Abigail Mathis.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Shit! Okay. Uh—

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m gonna float over to Abigail Mathis, not float, I guess slowly walk. How— it— within earshot.

speaker: Travis
lines: Mmkay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, are they having a conversation when we walk in? Or is she just drowning her sorrows right now?

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, she is both drinking but also waiting. I think she kind of expected you sooner.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, I walk up to the bar and sit down at the stool next to her, and I say

speaker: Errol
lines: Lemme get uh, two root beers— I— lemme get one root beer, please. Uh, and you can put it on the Grayson’s tab.

speaker: Abigail
lines: About. Goddamn. Time.

speaker: Errol
lines: …No need to take the Lord’s name in vain, Abigail. We’re out here you know, busting our humps trying to find out what we can find out.

speaker: Abigail
lines: It— [sighs pointedly] My son has been locked in that cage for almost an hour. You better be close to solving this goddamn thing.

speaker: Errol
lines: Wheels of justice turn pretty slow and that root beer is… Listen Abigail, here’s what we know your son’s covered in blood, and we found out that it is Jeremiah’s blood. And he’s got claw marks across his gut, and we can’t just release your son, he’s the most likely suspect still, so I know you’re frustrated and everything, but—

speaker: Abigail
lines: My son would not do this. He is a good boy, he would not have done this.

speaker: Errol
lines: He’s a good boy, but he’s a shit suspect. He wouldn’t really tell us much when we were in there talking to him.

speaker: Abigail
lines: He— he always has been quiet.

speaker: Errol
lines: Yeah, that’s agai— and not super helpful and again that root beer though? Is it…? What are you do— you brewing the sarsaparilla back there? What’s the—

speaker: Travis
lines: Wilder just kinda glares at you and continues polishing cups.

speaker: Errol
lines: What’s— you— you got beef, bud?

speaker: Justin
lines: Wilder watches one of the mugs floats over to the root beer and begins to fill itself.

speaker: Errol
lines: I’m doing that with my mind.

speaker: Justin
lines: It is placed in front of— in front of Errol.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wilder reaches underneath the counter and pulls out a club with a silver tip, and you can see engraved upon it is the symbol of The Church, and he points it—

speaker: Justin
lines: You see the mug start to float back over and upend itself, and the— then it goes over to the sink and is washed and is placed back in its place.

speaker: Wilder
lines: Show yourself, ghost.

speaker: Augustus
lines: First off, I have a name.

speaker: Justin
lines: And I materialize in front of him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What two?

speaker: Justin
lines: So I— what? I can be… seen and heard, but not felt.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s a good call in this situation.

speaker: Augustus
lines: We didn’t come for any trouble, my good man. We are here to investigate a terrible crime and to free one of your lupine brethren from the shackles of injustice. We just need a moment of your time, and we’ll be on our way.

speaker: Travis
lines: In fact, I’m gonna say he sounds like this

speaker: Wilder
lines: Get behind my bar again and you won’t be walking out. Or—

speaker: Augustus
lines: Well…

speaker: Wilder
lines: Should I say floating out?

speaker: Travis
lines: And he kinda like, give you a bit of a smile-glare. He smiles, but not with his eyes!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ahh, there he is! There he is! He’s smizing.

speaker: Augustus
lines: I appreciate the concessions made to my phantasmagoric nature. Not the threat, but I do appreciate that you recognize that I am a ghost.

speaker: Errol
lines: Alright I’m gonna give up on Operation Root Beer. Abigail, listen, when we were talking to Dylan—

speaker: Augustus
lines: Now I’ve almost got it cracked, give me a second.

speaker: Errol
lines: When we were talking to Dylan, he’s— mentioned something about “her”… not wanting— not wanting him to talk. Just curious if you ah, you know who that might be.

speaker: Abigail
lines: I can tell you there’s only one “her” Dylan cares about, and it’s his sister.

speaker: Errol
lines: Lemme add that to the old clue book. What’s ah— what’s the deal there, are they close?

speaker: Abigail
lines: They are twins from the same litter…

speaker: Augustus
lines: What’s her name?

speaker: Abigail
lines: Ann.

speaker: Errol
lines: Where might we find Ann here at this late hour?

speaker: Abigail
lines: Probably still asleep back at my house.

speaker: Errol
lines: Well I may need you to go wake her up and get her— get her here in town, ’cause we got— we gotta ask her some questions.

speaker: Abigail
lines: Do it yourself.

speaker: Travis
lines: And she slides you the key.

speaker: Abigail
lines: I need to be here, center of town in case something happens. I’m not leaving my boy.

speaker: Errol
lines: Abigail, I feel like maybe you don’t really understand the situation that we find ourselves in.

speaker: Travis
lines: You see the back of Abigail’s arms start to get a little hairier, her nails start to grow, and she turns and glares at you and says

speaker: Abigail
lines: No, I don’t think you understand, Errol. I am not leaving my boy. He is next in line to take over my place. I am not. Leaving him. Alone. Do you understand me, Errol?

speaker: Errol
lines: Yeah, I understand, you don’t wanna lose your boy… But things go south here, you’re gonna lose a lot more than that. The gravity of the situation is this, and I’m surprised, ’cause I would think [music fades in] somebody who’s been living around the mines for as long as you have would know a powder keg when you saw one. This town’s about to blow up. And… we’re trying to stop it. We’re— we’re on the same side here, we’re just asking for a little bit of help.

speaker: Abigail
lines: You stop it. I’m Plan B.

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Dust Theme by Griffin McElroy) continues]
